meanings.definition: To name or call by a particular name.
meanings.sent1: I will bename my new puppy 'Buddy'.
meanings.sent2: Please bename the characters in your story before writing.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny to bename the plants in the garden after famous singers.
meanings.sent4: She decided to bename her car 'Thunder' for its loud engine.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's power was so great that he could bename any creature with a single word.

meanings.definition: To mention or refer to by name.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the speaker will bename all the attendees.
meanings.sent2: It is important to bename your sources in the research paper.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to bename the suspect without revealing his identity.
meanings.sent4: The poet would bename the stars in his verses, giving them each a unique identity.
meanings.sent5: In the ancient ritual, the shaman would bename the newborns under the full moon.

meanings.sent1: The explorer decided to bename the newly discovered island 'Paradisia'.
meanings.sent2: Children often bename their favorite toys and treat them like friends.
meanings.sent3: The chef would bename his signature dish after his grandmother.
meanings.sent4: The king would bename his loyal knights after noble virtues.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder would bename each star in the sky to teach the children about constellations.
